Setting Chart Scale Properties

Note: This topic applies to charting in the Windows client only.

The application Chart window allows you to customize axis settings for your charts by using the Scale tab on the Custom Properties dialog. Depending on what axis you select, some options become disabled.

To set chart scale options:

  1. Display a chart.

  2. Click the Chart Options button on the Chart window toolbar. This action displays the Chart Properties dialog.

  3. Select the Scale tab.

  4. From the Scale tab, select an axis to customize:

    • Main Y axis button.

    • X axis option button (available only for scatter charts). When this button is selected, the Main Y axis group below is renamed the X axis group. Contents of the group do not change.

    • Secondary Y axis button (not available).

    • Main Y axis group:

      • Minimum: Enter the lowest number in the range shown by the axis. If this number is larger than the one you entered for Maximum, the chart will be clipped.

      • Maximum: Enter the highest number in the range shown by the axis. If this number is smaller than the one you entered for Minimum, the chart will be clipped.

      • Scale unit: Enter the number represented by 1 unit on the chart. For example, enter 1,000 to have each unit on the chart represent 1,000 units. The scale appears in the upper left portion of the chart. Values are divided by the scale unit. When using a scale unit other than the default 1, select Fixed as the increment gap (see below) and set a value for the increment.

      • Decimals: Enter the number of decimals to use in the number displayed for each tick mark.

      • Increment (gap) option: Select Automatic to allow StarTeam to determine the size of the interval between tick marks along the axis. Select Fixed to set the size of the interval between tick marks along the axis. Then enter the interval in the text box.

    • Show zero axis: Select to invert elements with values that are less than zero.

    • Axis scale group:

      • Linear button: Select to use a linear scale.

      • Logarithmic button: Select to use a logarithmic scale. Enter the base in the text box.

  5. After making your selections, click Apply to apply your settings without closing the dialog. Moving to another tab is equivalent to clicking Apply.

  6. To close the dialog, click OK.
